sense.def:
Kadar človek ob svojem prihodu
brings someone or something with him/her
, nekdo pride z njim ali pa nekaj prinese s seboj.

seg.quote: He would have to bring Judy with him.
Please bring your calculator to every lesson.

sense.def:
To bring something to a different place or position
pomeni nekaj prestaviti na drug kraj ali v drugačen položaj.

seg.quote: He opened the case and brought out a pair of glasses.
Sheldon brought his right hand to his head.

sense.def:
To bring something to someone
pomeni nekaj iti iskat za nekoga drugega ali nekomu nekaj nesti.

seg.quote: Bring me a glass of wine.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
brings people to come to a place
, povzroči, da ljudje pridejo v tisti kraj.

seg.quote: The festival brings a great many people to Glastonbury.

sense.def:
To bring someone or something into a particular state or condition
pomeni povzročiti, da je nekdo ali nekaj v takem stanju.

seg.quote: These ideas had brought him into conflict with Stalin.
The wind had brought several trees down.
He brought the car to a stop.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
brings a particular feeling, situation, or quality
, povzroči določeno čustvo, okoliščine ali lastnost.

seg.quote: Could it be true that money did not bring happiness?
The biting wind brought tears to her eyes.

sense.def:
Kadar človek
cannot bring himself to do something
, se ne more odločiti, da bi tisto storil.

cit.quote: prisiliti se, pripraviti se k čemu

seg.quote: I could not bring myself to touch him.

sense.def:
To bring a legal action against someone
pomeni nekoga uradno obtožiti, da je storil nekaj nezakonitega.

cit.quote: vložiti tožbo proti komu, tožiti koga

sense.def:
To bring something about
pomeni doseči, da se nekaj zgodi.

seg.quote: The Administration helped bring about a peaceful settlement.

sense.def:
To bring someone or something along
pomeni pripeljati nekoga ali prinesti nekaj s seboj, ko kam gremo.

seg.quote: Bring your friends along.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
brings back a memory
, povzroči, da začnemo o nečem razmišljati.

seg.quote: Losing a husband can bring back memories of childhood loss.

sense.def:
Kadar človek
brings back a fashion or practice
, znova uvede modo ali navado, ki je obstajala v preteklosti.

seg.quote: Many of the students appear to be trying to bring back the crew cut.

sense.def:
To bring down a government or ruler
pomeni povzročiti, da vlada ali vladar izgubi oblast.

seg.quote: A national strike would bring the government down.

sense.def:
To bring forward a meeting or lecture
pomeni urediti tako, da sta sestanek ali predavanje na vrsti prej, kot je bilo predvideno.

seg.quote: The meeting has been brought forward to Tuesday.

sense.def:
Kadar človek
brings forward an argument or proposal
, trditev ali predlog pojasni tako, da ljudje lahko razmislijo o njem.

Kadar vlada ali organizacija
brings in a new law or system
, uvede nov zakon ali sistem.

seg.quote: The government intends to bring in legislation to control their activities.

sense.def:
To bring in money
pomeni zaslužiti denar;

seg.quote: Tourism is a big industry, bringing in £7 billion a year.

sense.def:
To bring off something difficult
pomeni, da nekomu uspe narediti nekaj zahtevnega;

Kadar človek ali podjetje
brings out a new product
, začne izdelovati in prodajati nov izdelek.

seg.quote: I've just brought out a book on Dostoevski.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
brings out a particular kind of behaviour in someone
, povzroči določeno vedênje pri tistem človeku

seg.quote: These dreadful circumstances bring out the worst in everybody.

sense.def:
Kadar človek nekoga, ki je v nezavesti,
brings round
ali kadar ga
brings to
, poskrbi, da se spet osvesti.

To bring up a child
pomeni skrbeti za otroka, dokler ne odraste.

seg.quote: Tony was brought up strictly.

sense.def:
To bring up a particular subject
pomeni vpeljati določeno témo v razpravo ali pogovor.
